text:
**Page 1**
"""
Review of Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba Infinity Castle movie 
Example 1 
I watched this in the cinema with my dad. What an experience! Epic movie, beautiful 
animation, good music, and great English dub as well. My favorite character in the 
movie was Zenitsu; his scenes are awesome and his English voice actor was so good. I 
really liked Akaza's sad backstory as well. I recommend everyone to watch this movie 
on the big screen if possible. That is my review of Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba 
Infinity Castle. I give it a 9.1 out of 10. what You Guys Think ? 
Example 2 
It's 3/10 for me. Zenitsu's fight is less than 3 mins - something we're all hyped up to 
see. A lot of flashbacks in the middle of the fights, cutting tempo. Nothing still 
compares to the entertainment district gyutaro 2 vs 4 long scene. 
Plenty of stills with long dialogues. The weekly anime did a wonderful job in 
animation, here some seems rushed, especially the breathing style neck cutting 
scenes. Still remember the beautiful change in Tanjiro water style going after the 
female demon. 
Our gang today are anime fans and all came to similar agreement on this movie. 
Example 3 
I wonder where the money for this movie even went to? What exactly did they 
animate? Theres barely anything at all actually moving, besides the procedurally 
generated environment and houdini vfx 
Example 4 
I'd give it a 9 for the animation, sounds, choreo that hyped up the key scenes. A point 
knock down due to the length. That said I went in with realistic expectations that it 
can't be 2.5 hours straight of non-stop fighting nor having significant additional 
storylines or fillers that didn't exist in the manga as it's a fairly accurate adaptation of 
the source content 
Example 5 
I read the manga when it finished and I haven’t seen the anime since mugen train 
but having a 2.5 hour movie and so much filler is insane to expect people to sit 
through. Of course it’s beautiful but it drags soooo much for the amount of other 
stuff that could have been shown. Setting up for another movie I get. Having the 
longest flashback I’ve ever seen in an anime is a waste of the audiences time. So 
many people were checked out and had to sit through 30 more minutes by the time 
it was done. By far the biggest complaint. Other than that it was good but my god, 
it’s kind of painful to sit through. 
TL;DR the animation and music is good as always, way too long with the 
flashbacks/exposition
"""
